answerBox.snippet: In most cases, one- or two-digit numbers are actually mold numbers that indicate the specific bottle mold or section in an automatic bottle machine. If numerous molds were identical, each one received its own number. Base numbers also indicate bottle styles or shapes, manufacturing dates, or factory location codes.
snippetHighlighted: one- or two-digit numbers are actually mold numbers that indicate the specific bottle mold or section in an automatic bottle machine

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to read the bottom of old glass bottles?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
On the base of many bottles, there is merely a number (or numbers). These marks were frequently used as mould identification, indicating a specific mould used by a glass factory. If similar moulds were made for a particular bottle, they were often serially numbered (1 to 12).
Sep 12, 2021

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I tell how old a bottle is?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: It is true that the mold seams can be used like a thermometer to determine the approximate age of a bottle. The closer to the top of the bottle the seams extend, the more recent was the production of the bottle.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Bottle Dating - Society for Historical Archaeology

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What are the codes on the bottom of bottles?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Mould code It can be represented in the form of alphanumeric numbers, digital codes or a dot code. The mould code is used to uniquely identify the glass container. Digital and dot codes can be used for automatic sorting at the cold end, while alphanumeric codes require manual sorting.
